data.title: What Games Do You Think Need A Reboot
data.meta_description: What games do you think (or wish) should have a remake, remaster, reboot, or sequel and why?
data.text:
Stubbs The Zombie

Man oh man this game with a graphical update alone would be a must buy today. In 2019 this game is still original and fun, would love to see it ported to the MCC engine and maybe a whole new game after that

Totally agree with this one. I fell in love with the poetic storytelling and unique fighting style.

Apart from Child of Light, I would LOVE to see Torchlight 3. T2 was brilliant and I would love to see the world expanded 100x

2 of them…

Freelancer. It’s practically abandonware by now so it shouldn’t be that difficult to make similar in feel game. I don’t have a billion dollars to even attempt Star Citizen and Elite Dangerous turned out aggressively boring. I just want some decent space game ala Freelancer.

Patapon. It shouldn’t be all that difficult. It’s a 4 button rhythm game. I can make one if I had a composer on hand

They made HOB, the game sold bad and reviewed meh and they bankrupted basically. Now the studio is gone and no more Torchlight games

That as well! I knew I forgot something!

Also, a reboot of the Black&White franchise.

This is on my Steam Wishlist…I didn’t know the studio went bust…Complete crap

It’s their fault…

Since Torchlight 2 they haven’t released anything… What was supposed to keep them afloat? Now HOB is a decent puzzle game but it’s a niche and people just wanted another torchlight…

Oh well…

Don’t Peter Mole something still owns the IP?

Well, here you go. A snippet from Wikipedia:

On November 3, 2017, Perfect World announced the closure of Runic Games, along with large layoffs at Motiga. Perfect World said the closure was to reflect their company’s focus on games as a service. One set of developers from Runic, including Marsh Lefler, Patrick Blank, Allen Fong, and John Dunbar, along with former Gearbox Software members, established Monster Squad Games and are currently developing a player-versus-environment cooperative game.

I have no idea who owns what. It was published EA, but MS bought Lionhead Studios somewhen at that time and a lot of devs left.

Proper Remake of Max Payne 1 and 2.

Why - I can get the games to run on Windows 10 but it is a bit of a process. It’d be nice to have versions of this game I don’t have to work to get to run.

Change - Get rid of the nightmare sequences and just have it be comic panels instead.

Keep - The comic panels and the gun play mechanics.

Chances of happening - Never. Rockstar owns the Max Payne IP and I don’t see them ever doing anything more with it.

Only recently I was thinking his much in would love a rerelease or Saints Row 2. The original PC port was so botched it was shocking and has never really been properly fixed. Made before saints row went off the rails with cartoon chunky graphics and all dark and moody, it was genuine competition for GTA, funny the GTA5 feel very much like Saint Row 2. I tjust had so much to do and was hugely fun tonplay co-op the ones after were a steady decline.

But for older games as a lot if these in here are still quite modern and from the HD age anyway…

I would like to see a new Speed Freaks. Fun cart racer from the PS1

C&C Generals including Zero:Hour.

I played this game for over 10 years. However I doubt that we will ever get a proper re-make. EA faggots tried to make Generals 2 free to play probably with many micro-transactions. People didn’t like it so they cancelled the development.

I would love a remake of C&C generals

But I also would be scared with EA doing it haha
